Module it.polimi.ingsw.am11
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am11.cards.playable

Class PlayableCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am11.cards.playable.PlayableCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
CardIdentity, FieldCard, PointsCountable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GoldCard, ResourceCard
public abstract sealed class PlayableCard extends Object implements CardIdentity, PointsCountable, FieldCard permits GoldCard, ResourceCard
Abstract class representing a playable card in the field.

Subclasses must be constructed using the provided PlayableCard.Builder inner class to ensure consistent object creation.

This class contains methods to get the card's color, points, type, placing requirements, points requirements, symbol to collect, and id.

It also contains methods to check if a corner is available if there is an item in a corner, and if the card's color is equal to a given color.

The class also contains a nested Builder class for creating instances of PlayableCard.

    • isRetroAvailable

      public static boolean isRetroAvailable (@NotNull @NotNull Corner corner)
      Checks retro corners availability.

      As the physical game makes all PlayableCard retro corners available; it will always return true.

      Parameters:
      corner - the corner to check
      Returns:
      always true

    • getPlacingRequirements

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull public abstract @NotNull com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<Color,Integer> getPlacingRequirements()
      Gets the number of colors in the field needed to place the card.

      For ResourceCard all color requirements will be 0 as they have no requirements to place.

      Returns:
      a Map of keys colors and as values their requirements to place on the field in int

    • getPointsRequirements

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull public abstract @NotNull PointsRequirementsType getPointsRequirements()
      Gets the method needed to score this card points value.

      If the card doesn't give points it will return PointsRequirementsType.CLASSIC as the card points value would be 0.

      Returns:
      type of requirement needed to score points
      See Also:
      • PointsRequirementsType
